questions.text: What is the Roman numeral for 57?
Which one of these musicals has a character named Audrey II in it?
questions.explanation:
Little Shop of Horrors.

	Audrey II is the name of the blood craving Venus fly trap that Seymour has.

questions.text: Which country's capital is the same as its country's name?
questions.explanation:
Luxembourg.

	London is the capital of England. Lisbon is the capital of Portugal. Luanda is the capital of Angola.

questions.text: Who wrote the "Little House on the Prairie" book series?
questions.explanation:
Laura Ingalls Wilder.

	Louisa May Alcott wrote "Little Women". Lillian Jackson Braun wrote "The Cat Who..." series. Laurell K. Hamilton wrote "Guilty Pleasures".

questions.text: Who does Orlando Bloom play in "The Lord of the Rings"?
questions.explanation:
Legolas.

	Orlando Bloom was born January 13, 1977 in England.

questions.text: Which one of these sports teams plays in Los Angeles?
questions.explanation:
Lakers.

	The Lions are a football team in Detroit. The Lightning are an ice hockey team in Tampa Bay. I just made up the losers, no team is called that...at least not by choice.

questions.text: Which word is the English translation of the Latin word 'lux'?
questions.explanation:
light.

	Lux is the nominative case for light.

questions.text: Who was the sixteenth president of the United States of America?
questions.explanation:
Lincoln & Abe Lincoln & Abraham Lincoln.

	Abe Lincoln wrote "The Gettysburg Address" while on a train ride to Gettysburg.

Long live Mexico.

	Viva comes from the Spanish verb vivir which means "to live". Viva Mexico! is an idiom, not a literal translation. It is also sometimes seen as Viva la Mexico.  The literal translation would be closer to "alive Mexico".

questions.text: Who is the main vampire in the second book of Anne Rice's "Vampire Chronicles"?
questions.explanation:
Lestat & Lioncourt & lestat lioncourt.

	The second book in the series if "The Vampire Lestat". The first was "Interview with a Vampire".
